intro: Adisca zippelii, commonly known as the Zippel's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique floral structure typical of the spurge family. Adisca zippelii is native to South Africa and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
